Nightshift emerges from the chamber, black as he had requested, but complet=
ely transmetallic .  His eyes glow a bright green.  Tucson is the next to e=
merge, with a more substantial build to his frame.  Even his wings extend w=
ith more of a wing span, as they pulsate with stripes of bright blue runnin=
g across them.  Quickstride emerges fully transmetallic as he trots to atte=
ntion.
Uproar emerges with a mighty roar that seems to rattle the house a b=
it.  Straightshot waddles out with a back full of electrically charged quil=
ls.

" Woww, you guys really changed.  Ohh so did I.  I like it."

Local ar=
tist who specializes in illustration, using traditional and digital media. =
 

I also specialize in hand made crafts.  Great for any occasion!  

Need =
a great gift idea that is original?  No problem!  Email me at this address =
and we will talk.  

On May 23, 2012, at 2:17 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercycl=
onus@...> wrote:

> The CR chambers hummed and churned as lights blin=
ked and sensor scans
> flickered back and forth. For some it meant repairs,=
 for others it
> meant a change of form and even some substance. Energy fed=
 through
> power cable as computer code and data streamed as well. There wa=
s new
> lives starting and old ones connecting and reconnecting. Things wer=
e
> changing and realigning.
> 
> What would the future hold, would new fea=
tures were to be added to
> this landscape that they wee creating?
> 
> Onl=
y time would tell.
> 
> The CR chambers blinked one last time as they indic=
ated that their
> occupants had passed through and had been converted.
> 
>=
 After a moment the doors hissed and then slid open.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> - Pres=
ton
> 

--Apple-Mail-3C6B9C40-8CBC-4EAE-A8AD-4600C39EDDC5

      <p>The CR chambers hummed and churned as lights blinked and se=
nsor scans<br>
flickered back and forth. For some it meant repairs, for oth=
ers it<br>
meant a change of form and even some substance. Energy fed throu=
gh<br>
power cable as computer code and data streamed as well. There was ne=
w<br>
lives starting and old ones connecting and reconnecting. Things were<=
br>
changing and realigning.<br>
<br>
What would the future hold, would new=
 features were to be added to<br>
this landscape that they wee creating?<br=
>
<br>
Only time would tell.<br>
<br>
The CR chambers blinked one last time=
 as they indicated that their<br>
occupants had passed through and had been=
 converted.<br>
<br>
After a moment the doors hissed and then slid open.<br=
>
